body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners the undersigned would respectfully represent that at the February term of the Fleming Circuit Court James Weaver was found guilty of the offence of Horse Stealing and Sentenced to the Penitentiary for a term of four years under the following Circumstances Said Weaver was a Soldier in the 53D Regiment of Ky Volunteers of the Army of the United States and at home on furlow and while at home he took horses from what he termed Sympathizers with the rebellion and rode there about publickly alleging as a reason that the rebels had killed his horse while at meeting and that he had a right to appropriate the use of the horses of Sympathizers Said Weaver never disposed of any of the horses and always Considered an honest upright Young man We do not believe
Said Weaver is a dishonest man neither do we believe he intended to Steal or that he was feloniously guilty of the offence for which he was sentenced We there fore recomend him to Executive favor Hoping your Excellency will interpose in his behalf and restore him to his friends believing as he is a very young man that he might yet be made a good Citizen We are very respect fully your Obt ^fellow^ Citizens --
